page.title: 04La Mare Vineyard-Interview
page.content: We went to La Mare Vineyard to interview Mrs. Blaney. She said that she pressed the grapes to make wine but did not put anything in the wine apart from grapes. Then she told us that she had four varieties of grapes. Seyval, Reichensteiner, Schonburger and Scheurebe. She also added that the vineyard was six and a half acres and that they had just planted another acre. She then told us that she had delivered wine as far away as Iceland and that her house was built in 1797. She also told us that she grew cider apples and had an acre of the orchards for them. She said that she still used an old-fashioned press for the apples but not for the grapes and added that the grapes called Huxelrebe and Reichensteiner made the best wine.
